slot.value: The link to a gNodeB has been re-established. A maximum of 25 events per second can be generated.

slot.name: causeRaise
slot.value: The link to a gNodeB has been re-established. This event is generated when a gNodeB sends an NG Reset message, or a known gNodeB sends an NG Setup Request message. Frequent occurrences of this event may be due to transmission problems to the gNodeB detected by SCTP.

slot.name: consequence
slot.value: The AMF will change the state of the UE handled by the gNodeB to CM-IDLE.

slot.name: additionalText
slot.value: Unknown TAI is discovered from Write-Replace Warning Request or Stop Warning Request with serial number <SN> and message identifier <MsgID>.

slot.name: description
slot.value: The event is generated when there are unknown TAIs in the initiating message of Write-Replace Warning or Stop Warning from CBC and the #SBcAllowUnknownTAIs# parameter is set to true.

slot.name: causeRaise
slot.value: The configuration in the CBC node is wrong.

slot.name: consequence
slot.value: UE might not be informed with the public warning in these TAIs.

slot.name: additionalText
slot.value: MSC pool move operation completed at <date>

slot.name: description
slot.value: This event is generated when an MSC pool move job is completed.

slot.name: causeRaise
slot.value: This event is generated when an MSC pool move operation is completed.

slot.name: additionalText
slot.value: A capsule restart is in progress on (EnodeId=<EnodeId>)

slot.name: description
slot.value: This event is generated when a failure or a suspected failure has caused a restart of an Erlang capsule.

slot.name: causeRaise
slot.value: A failure or a suspected failure in an Erlang capsule.

slot.name: consequence
action
slot.value: Relevant logs should be made available to Ericsson for analysis. For more information about what logs to collect, see #Data Collection Guideline#.

slot.name: additionalText
slot.value: Status change in remote subsystem occurred at SPC <number>. Status of SSN <number> is <state>. Affected NodeID is <number>, with Local SPC <number>.

slot.name: description
slot.value: The SCCP keeps track of the status of all locally configured network users, that is, SSNs, in the network. If the status is changed for a user in a network node, the SCCP layers in all other nodes or SPs in the network are notified. Even their local users are notified in form of an N_STATE_ind primitive. For ITU and TTC standards, the SPC value is printed in the format: 0-16383 and 0-65535 respectively. For ANSI and China standards, the SPC value is printed in the format: 0-16777215 ([0-255]-[0-255]-[0-255]).

slot.name: causeRaise
slot.value: The status of the remote SSN has changed.;Valid states are:;*0 allowed;*2 prohibited;

slot.name: consequence
slot.value: If the state is marked as prohibited an N_STATE_ind is flagged. SCCP advises other users of the status change and stops sending traffic to the SSN at the remote node. #Note:The stop sending traffic measurement by the SCCP applies when the operator uses GT addressing with GTT response that includes an SPC and an SSN.Note# Termination Indicator must be set to 1, route on SSN. The SCCP does not stop the traffic if only the SPC is given. If the SSN is unavailable and the message is a connection-less message, then the message return procedure is initiated. If the SSN is unavailable and the message is a CR, a connection-oriented message, then the connection refusal procedure is initiated. In addition, if the subsystem has failed, SCCP management is notified that a message was received for a failed subsystem.

slot.name: action
slot.value: No remedial action can be taken at the local node, only at the remote node.

slot.name: description
slot.value: This event is generated when an AP or DP has a suspected software or hardware fault.

slot.name: causeRaise
slot.value: This event is generated when an AP or DP has a suspected software or hardware fault.

slot.name: action
slot.value: Relevant logs should be made available to Ericsson for analysis. For more information about what logs to collect, see PIU or VM Failure in #Troubleshooting#.

slot.name: description
slot.value: The admCapacityLicenseChanged event is generated if a capacity limit is changed.

slot.name: area
slot.value: SW Load Check and License Mgmt

slot.name: additionalText
slot.value: The local user storage is recovered from the backup made on <date>.

slot.name: description
slot.value: The localUserStorageRecovered event indicates that the local user storage is recovered automatically from a database corruption through a local backup.

slot.name: causeRaise
slot.value: The local user storage was corrupted.

slot.name: consequence
slot.value: Recent user management changes since last local user storage backup can be lost.

slot.name: additionalText
slot.value: Message from link layer received from signaling link on <number>. Must be re-routed to different DPC. Filtered <number> times since last report.

slot.name: description
slot.value: Message from link layer received from the specified link must be re-routed to a different DPC. The link is a narrowband signaling link with EqPos, trunk and time slot.

slot.name: consequence
slot.value: When the network is not properly configured the message can be discarded. The link is a narrowband signaling link with EqPos, Trunk and Timeslot.

slot.name: action
slot.value: **Check the log file for further details of message originator and destination.;**Advice originator that message to the destination cannot be sent via this node.;

slot.name: additionalText
slot.value: Message received from link layer containing an unsupported Network Indicator from signaling link on <number>. Filtered <number> times since last report.

slot.name: description
slot.value: A message was received from a link layer containing an unsupported NI. The link is a narrowband signaling link with EqPos, trunk and time slot.

slot.name: causeRaise
slot.value: This event is generated when a message with an unsupported NI is received. The NI is used for discrimination of messages between functionally different networks.

slot.name: consequence
slot.value: A message received with an unsupported NI is discarded.

slot.name: action
slot.value: **Check the alarm and event log for further details, take note of the NI.;**Check the configuration for the given NI.;**The NI of the network connected through this link and the NI of the link is to be consistent.;**If problem is not solved, check the SS7 log file for further information.;

slot.name: additionalText
slot.value: A PGW restart notification is received on the gtpv2-c path = <SGSN-MME VIP address> (SGSN-MME) - <SGW VIP address> (SGW) - <PGW VIP address> (PGW).

slot.name: description
slot.value: This event is generated after a PGW has restarted and the SGW notifies the SGSN-MME of the restart.

slot.name: causeRaise
slot.value: This event is generated when the SGW notifies the SGSN-MME of a restart of PGW through the PGW Restart Notification message.

slot.name: consequence
slot.value: All the affected PDN connections that were activated on the PGW and the SGW are deleted.

slot.name: description
causeRaise
slot.value: The sctpAlarmEventStormInfo event is generated in the following situations: 1. When storm of a specific SCTP alarm or event, detected in the front-end process by exceeding the alarm-specific threshold is finished. 2. When storm of a specific SCTP alarm or event, detected in the SS7 O&M entity by exceeding the alarm-specific threshold is finished. 3. When storm of SCTP alarms and events, detected in the front-end process by exceeding the general threshold is finished. Alarms and events covered by alarm and event specific protection respectively are not taken into account.

slot.name: consequence
slot.value:
Depending on the original cause the following consequences are possible: 1. In case of alarm-specific storm detection in the SCTP front-end process: The affected SCTP alarm or event from the affected process was not reported for around 30 seconds. Some of the affected SCTP alarms from the affected process were cleared even if the problem reported in the alarm is present.
2. In case of alarm-specific storm detection in the SS7 O&M entity: The affected SCTP alarm or event from all processes was not reported for around 2 minutes. The affected SCTP alarm from all processes was cleared even if the problem reported in the alarm is present.
3. In case of general alarm storm detection in the SCTP front-end process a number of SCTP alarms and events from the affected process was not reported.

slot.name: additionalText
slot.value: One of the Billing Systems is going down.

slot.name: description
slot.value: The gtpprimeAnotherNodeDown event is generated if one of the billing systems, which the SGSN currently communicates with, is about to shut down.

slot.name: causeRaise
slot.value: This event is generated when the billing system has reported that one of the billing systems which the SGSN currently communicates with is about to shut down.

slot.name: additionalText
slot.value: All UE-associated logical S1 connections from <eNodeB_Type> eNodeB <eNodeB_Id> in PLMN <MCC-MNC> <with eNodeB name eNodeB_Name> has been removed.

slot.name: description
slot.value: The link to an eNodeB has been re-established. A maximum of 25 events per second can be generated.

slot.name: causeRaise
slot.value: The link to an eNodeB has been re-established. This event is generated when an eNodeB sends an S1-AP Reset message, or a known eNodeB sends an S1 Setup Request message. Frequent occurrences of this event may be due to transmission problems to the eNodeB detected by SCTP.

slot.name: consequence
slot.value: The MME will change the state of the UE handled by the eNodeB to ECM-IDLE.

slot.name: additionalText
slot.value: Signaling link on <number> is available for User Part.

slot.name: description
slot.value: The specified link is available for the User Parts' signaling traffic. The link is a narrowband signaling link with EqPos, trunk and time slot. #Note:This event is only relevant during startup. Otherwise, the #ss7Mtpl3LkUnavlForUP# alarm is cleared when a link becomes available. Note#.

slot.name: causeRaise
slot.value: The signaling link has become available for User Part. The link is a narrowband signaling link with EqPos, Trunk and Timeslot.

slot.name: consequence
slot.value: The link is assumed to be in service and SS7 messages can be sent and received.

slot.name: action
slot.value: None. This event is of notification value only.

slot.name: additionalText
slot.value: Signaling link on <number> is in service.

slot.name: description
slot.value: A signaling link has been successfully aligned. The link is a narrowband signaling link with EqPos, trunk and time slot. #Note:This event is only relevant during startup. Otherwise, the #ss7Mtpl3LkOutOfServ# alarm is cleared when a link becomes available.Note#

slot.name: causeRaise
slot.value: This link has been successfully aligned. The link is a narrowband signaling link with EqPos, Trunk and Timeslot.

slot.name: consequence
slot.value: The link is assumed to be in service and SS7 messages can be sent or received.

slot.name: action
slot.value: No remedial action is required this event is of notification value only.

slot.name: description
slot.value: This event is generated when a pool move operation, which is started by the action_pool_move_start or action_pool_move_validation_start CLI command, has finished. An operator can show the status of the move operation: *If the move operation is started by the action_pool_move_start CLI command, use the show_pool_move_job_status CLI command to show the status of the move operation.;*If the move operation is started by the action_pool_move_validation_start CLI command, use the show_pool_move_validation_status or show_pool_move_validation_status_detail CLI command to show the status of the move operation.;

slot.name: causeRaise
slot.value: This event is generated when a pool move operation has finished.

slot.name: description
slot.value: The SGSN has received a GRncID which is unconfigured in the database that holds information for all known RNCs. The GRncID must be unique for each RNC.

slot.name: causeRaise
consequence
slot.value: No connectionless signaling between the SGSN and the RNC is possible. The RANAP procedures that are affected are Reset, Reset Resource, and Paging.

slot.name: action
slot.value: Check the RNC configuration, by using the #get_rnc# and #modify_rnc# CLI commands.

slot.name: additionalText
slot.value: Pool move operation has stopped abnormally due to the S3/S4 Architecture Support feature not being activated on the SGSN with NRI <NRI> and IP <IPAddress>, which is selected as the target for smooth move of WCDMA users over the S16 interface.

slot.name: description
slot.value: This event is generated when a pool move operation is stopped because the S3/S4 Architecture Support feature is not activated on one of the target SGSNs during the smooth move of WCDMA users over the S16 interface. The smooth move of WCDMA users over the S16 interface is only applicable when the S3/S4 Architecture Support feature is activated on the target SGSN.

slot.name: causeRaise
slot.value: This event is generated when the S3/S4 Architecture Support feature is not activated on one of the target SGSNs during the smooth move of WCDMA users over the S16 interface.

slot.name: action
slot.value: 1. For the SGSN on which the S3/S4 Architecture Support feature is not activated, make sure the S16 IP address of this SGSN is not configured in the NRI table on the source SGSN. 2. Start the pool move operation using the #action_pool_move_start# command. If the move operation is for validation purposes, start the pool move operation using the #action_pool_move_validation_start# CLI command.

slot.name: description
slot.value: The admLicenseKeyFileInvalid event is generated if the license key is invalid.

slot.name: causeRaise
slot.value: The start or expiry date is invalid, the fingerprint does not match the SGSN-MME, or the signature is faulty.

slot.name: consequence
slot.value: The current license settings in the SGSN-MME are unchanged.

slot.name: action
slot.value: Report this event to Ericsson and request a new license-key file.

slot.name: area
slot.value: SW Load Check and License Mgmt

slot.name: additionalText
slot.value: MS MSC move operation completed at <date>

slot.name: description
slot.value: This event is generated when an MS MSC# move job is completed.

slot.name: causeRaise
slot.value: This event is generated when an MS MSC move operation is completed.

slot.name: description
slot.value: When an equipment is blocked, it is removed from operation and it remains blocked after a node restart. However, it is possible to manually replace or put the blocked equipment back into operation again.

slot.name: causeRaise
slot.value: This event is generated when an PIU or VM is blocked. The equipment have either been blocked automatically or manually.

slot.name: consequence
slot.value: The consequence depends on the role of the PIU or VM. See related alarms and events for further information on the consequences. The SGSN-MME may not operate with full capacity and it may have lost redundancy. If all of the AP, DP, or SS7/SCTP DP roles are blocked, the SGSN-MME enters failsafe state. For more information, see nocNodeOutOfService.

slot.name: action
slot.value: The trigger of the event can be hardware or software related. See PIU or VM Failure in #Troubleshooting# for further information on how to investigate the reason for the event.

slot.name: additionalText
slot.value: SCTP has received an ICMP message from source IP <ipaddress> with remote IP <ipaddress> (port <port>), on local IP <ipaddress> (port <port>). Message type <number> with code <number>. Filtered <number> times since last report.

slot.name: description
slot.value: The sctpIcmpRcvd event is generated when SCTP has received an ICMP message.

slot.name: causeRaise
slot.value: SCTP has received an ICMP message. The ICMP error originates from a problem in the underlying IP network. The purpose of an ICMP message is to provide feedback about problems in the communication environment, typically reporting errors in the processing of datagrams. ICMP messages are sent in several situations, for example when a datagram cannot reach its destination or when the gateway does not have the buffering capacity to forward a datagram. For further information, see Internet Control Message Protocol, IETF RFC792.

slot.name: consequence
slot.value: Unless an alternative path to the destination is available, traffic is not possible and the ss7M3uaAssociationDown alarm is raised.

slot.name: action
slot.value:
Depending on the type of ICMP message received, take the following actions:
Type 3 Destination Unreachable (Received when a packet is undeliverable). Action: Check the configuration and status of the SGSN-MME and the network.
Type 4 Source Quench (Received when destination is unable to process traffic as fast as the source is sending it).
Action: Check the configuration and status of the SGSN-MME with particular emphasis on the network.
Type 5 Redirect Message (Received when route being requested can be reached either locally or through a better path).
Action: The SGSN-MME does not perform ICMP redirection which is related to operator specific configuration, if implemented.
Type 11 Time Exceeded (Received when router or host discards a packet).
Action: Check the configuration and status of the SGSN-MME and the network.
See Troubleshooting, for further information.

slot.name: additionalText
slot.value: Unsuccessful forced rerouting attempt for traffic to DPC <number>. Affected NodeID is <number>, with Local SPC <number>.

slot.name: description
slot.value: Forced rerouting diverts the traffic to an alternative route when a signaling route to a given destination becomes unavailable. If links that can carry traffic to the destination are inhibited, an automated procedure to uninhibit these begins. All unavailable signaling links are repeatedly restarted in an attempt to realign. If the uninhibit is successful a controlled rerouting is performed. For ITU and TTC standards, both the SPC and DPC values are printed in the format: 0-16383 and 0-65535 respectively. For ANSI and China standards, both the SPC and DPC values are printed in the format: 0-16777215 ([0-255]-[0-255]-[0-255]).

slot.name: causeRaise
slot.value: Forced rerouting is used when a signalling route towards a given destination becomes unavailable (i.e. remote failures in a signalling network). It is used to divert traffic towards that destination to an alternative route. The forced rerouting failed. If no alternative route exists towards the concerned DPC, the destination becomes unavailable.

slot.name: consequence
slot.value: If automated realignment or use of alternative routes also fails the destination becomes unavailable.

slot.name: action
slot.value: **If the automated realignment or use of alternative routes fails: Check the SS7 traffic PIU for errors.;**Check the configuration of the concerned signaling link.;

slot.name: additionalText
slot.value: A local routing area with identity <MCC-MNC-LAC-RAC> already exists in the GSN for WCDMA.

slot.name: description
slot.value: The event nwcWcdmaRaExist is sent when the SGSN-MME for GSM and WCDMA access types receives cell information from a BSC containing an RAI that is already defined in the SGSN-MME as a WCDMA Systems local routing area.

slot.name: causeRaise
slot.value: This event is sent when the SGSN-MME for GSM and WCDMA access types receives cell information from a BSC containing an RAI that is already defined in the SGSN-MME as a WCDMA Systems local routing area.

slot.name: consequence
slot.value: The RAI is rejected and the BSC cannot connect to the SGSN-MME.

slot.name: action
slot.value: Verify that there is no overlap between GPRS for GSM and WCDMA in the network plans. Define which RAI to use for WCDMA and GSM, respectively. Reconfigure either the SGSN-MMEs or the BSCs to avoid routing area conflicts between GSM and WCDMA.

slot.name: additionalText
slot.value: A node restart is in progress.

slot.name: description
causeRaise
consequence
slot.value: All subscribers in the SGSN-MME are lost. Affected MSs and UEs are not notified. A restart on the permanent or current SC is performed.

slot.name: action
slot.value: Any crash reports showing the cause of the reload should be made available to Ericsson for analysis. For more information about what logs to collect, see #Troubleshooting#.

slot.name: additionalText
slot.value: RNC Initiated Reset received from RNC=<rnc>

slot.name: description
slot.value: An internal failure has occurred in the RNC, that is, the RNC has lost transaction reference information from all MSs. The RNC orders the SGSN to release all Iu connections associated with that particular RNC.

slot.name: causeRaise
slot.value: This event is generated when the SGSN has received an RNC-initiated Reset message.

slot.name: consequence
slot.value: The SGSN might be subjected to heavy load when reestablishing the Iu connections.

slot.name: additionalText
slot.value: Association with RemoteSpId <number> and LocalSpId <number> on SctpEndPointNo <number>, successfully established.

slot.name: description
slot.value: A signaling M3UA association has successfully been established. #Note: This event is relevant during startup only. Note#

slot.name: causeRaise
slot.value: This event is generated when the association has been succesfully established.

slot.name: consequence
slot.value: The association is assumed to be in service and SS7 messages can be sent and received.

slot.name: additionalText
slot.value: The SNS CONFIG procedure for NSEI <NSE ID> in the dynamic configuration for Gb over IP has failed due to the following cause: <cause code>.

slot.name: description
slot.value: The gbipNseConfigProcedureFailed event is generated when the dynamic configuration procedure has failed due to problems in the configuration procedure. The cause of the failure is provided in the cause field of the alarm text.

slot.name: causeRaise
slot.value: The cause values for this event are derived from those received in the SNS-CONFIG/SNS-CONFIG-ACK messages according to 3GPP recommendations. They are used to indicate that the dynamic configuration procedure has failed for the following reason:;*Missing SNS CONFIG-ACK (SGSN initiated): The SGSN did not receive an SNS-CONFIG-ACK message from the BSS. This indicates that the BSS did not confirm the SNS-CONFIG message sent by the SGSN.;*SNS CONFIG-ACK with cause code received (SGSN initiated): The BSS returned an SNS-CONFIG-ACK message to the SGSN with a cause value. This indicates that the BSS did not confirm the SNS-CONFIG message sent by the SGSN.;*Duplicate IP endpoints <IP address> (BSS initiated): The BSS has sent two or more identical IP endpoints in the SNS-CONFIG message.;*Unknown NSEI <NSE ID> (BSS initiated): The SNS-SIZE procedure has not been successfully completed for this NSEI.;*IPv6 endpoints received (BSS initiated): The BSS has provided a list of IPv6 addresses in the SNS-CONFIG message. The current version of the SGSN does not support IPv6 addresses on the NS layer.;*No IPv4 endpoints provided (BSS initiated): The BSS did not provide any IP endpoints in the SNS-CONFIG message.;*No IP endpoints with signaling weight greater than 0 (BSS initiated): The BSS did not provide any IP endpoint with a signaling weight greater than 0 in the SNS-CONFIG message. The SGSN needs at least one such remote endpoint per NSE to send signaling messages.;*Invalid IP endpoint (BSS initiated): This cause value is used if the list of IP endpoints provided by the BSS in the SNS-CONFIG message is not formatted according to 3GPP recommendation or is longer than indicated in the SNS-SIZE message.;*General protocol error (BSS initiated): This cause value is used if the SNS-CONFIG message is not formatted according to 3GPP recommendations or if no other cause value is applicable.;

slot.name: consequence
slot.value: The dynamic configuration procedure for this Gb interface has failed. The connectivity between SGSN and BSS cannot be established for this NSEI.;If a new dynamic configuration attempt starting with SNS-SIZE is initiated, the next Size procedure will not be processed in the SGSN before the timer #GbIpNseNsSizeProcedureInterval# has expired.

slot.name: action
slot.value: Depending on the cause code, the following action is recommended:;*Missing SNS-CONFIG-ACK (SGSN initiated): Involving the BSS O&M staff, review the configuration for Gb over IP in the BSS for consistency. Review the IP routing from the BSS to the SGSN.;*SNS-CONFIG-ACK with cause code received (SGSN initiated): Involving the BSS O&M staff, evaluate the received cause value. Review the configuration for Gb over IP in the SGSN and the BSS for consistency.;*Duplicate IP endpoints (BSS initiated): Involving the BSS O&M staff, review the configuration for Gb over IP in the BSS to make sure that IP addresses are not duplicated.;*Unknown NSEI (BSS initiated): Involving the BSS O&M staff, make sure that the BSS sends the same NSEI value in SNS-SIZE and SNS-CONFIG.;*IPv6 endpoints received (BSS initiated): Involving the BSS O&M staff, review the configuration for Gb over IP in the BSS to make sure that the BSS is not using IPv6 addresses.;*No IPv4 endpoints provided (BSS initiated): Involving the BSS O&M staff, review the configuration for Gb over IP in the BSS to make sure that IP addresses are locally assigned for the NS layer.;*No IP endpoints with signaling weight greater than 0 (BSS initiated): Involving the BSS O&M staff, review the configuration for Gb over IP in the BSS to make sure that at least one endpoint has a signaling weight greater than 0.;*Invalid IP endpoint (BSS initiated): Involving the BSS O&M staff, review the configuration for Gb over IP in the BSS to make sure that the BSS sends valid IPv4 endpoints formatted according to 3GPP as indicated in the SNS-SIZE message.;*General protocol error (BSS initiated): Involving the BSS O&M staff, review the configuration for Gb over IP in the SGSN and the BSS for consistency. Review the IP routing between the SGSN and the BSS. Make sure that BSS supports SNS signaling according to 3GPP.;Additional Information could be derived if the event #gbipNseNsStatusReceived# is generated for the same NSEI.

slot.name: additionalText
slot.value: A small restart is in progress.(<Restart Trigger Type>)

slot.name: description
slot.value:
A small restart restarts all SGSN-MME application processes in the control plane of all APs. All subscribers are preserved, except those in a transitional state. Subscribers in a transitional state are removed from the SGSN-MME. The CDRs for the affected subscribers are closed with the cause abnormal release.
The variable Restart Trigger Type can have the following values: #Term: Manual Term##Def: Restart is manually initiated by the operator.Def# #Term: Automatic Term##Def: Restart is because of software failure.Def#

slot.name: causeRaise
consequence
action
slot.value: If the event was caused by a software error, the relevant logs should be made available to Ericsson for analysis. For more information about what logs to collect, see #Troubleshooting#.

slot.name: additionalText
slot.value: Pool move operation is stopped abnormally due to the licensed feature 'MME Pool' is not enabled in the target MME with MMEC <MMEC> and IP <IPAddress>.

slot.name: description
slot.value: This event is generated when a pool move operation, which is started by the #action_pool_move_start# or action_pool_move_validation_start CLI command, is stopped. The pool move operation is stopped because licensed feature MME Pool is not enabled in one of the target MMEs.

slot.name: causeRaise
slot.value: This event is generated when licensed feature MME Pool is not enabled in one of the target MMEs.

slot.name: consequence
slot.value: The pool move operation is stopped.

slot.name: action
additionalText
slot.value: The SGSN Initiated Reset counter has reached the upper limit. No respons from RNC=<rnc_name>

slot.name: description
slot.value: This event is generated when the SGSN has sent a Reset signal towards one RNC NRafR times. The retransmissions of the Reset signal will stop if the SGSN (W) receives a Reset Acknowledge signal from the particular RNC. NRafR is a parameter.

slot.name: causeRaise
slot.value: This event is generated when a connection establishment is impossible between the RNC and the SGSN. The reason for this might be a faulty configured RNC in the SGSN or a faulty configured SGSN in the RNC or both.

slot.name: consequence
slot.value: No signalling between the SGSN and the RNC is possible.

slot.name: action
additionalText
slot.value: A restart in the SAPC <sapc host name> has taken place.

slot.name: description
slot.value: The Origin-State-Id AVP with an increased value is received, and therefore the SGSN-MME knows a restart in the SAPC <sapc host name> has taken place.

slot.name: causeRaise
slot.value: This event is generated when the SGSN-MME finds that the Origin-State-Id AVP from the SAPC increases.

slot.name: consequence
slot.value: All Smp sessions related to the restarted SAPC that are established before the restart will be locally deleted.

slot.name: additionalText
slot.value: Bind request at local SSN <number>. Affected NodeID is <number>, with Local SPC <number>.

slot.name: description
slot.value: The SCCP receives a N_BIND_req. The SSN is checked so it is not already in use. For ITU and TTC standards, the SPC value is printed in the format: 0-16383 and 0-65535 respectively. For ANSI and China standards, the SPC value is printed in the format: 0-16777215 ([0-255]-[0-255]-[0-255]).

slot.name: consequence
slot.value: It is checked whether the SSN is in use. If the SSN is not in use, the SCCP updates the address table and a positive N_BIND_conf is returned. If the SSN is already in use, a negative N_BIND_conf is returned.

slot.name: action
slot.value: This event is of notification value only.

slot.name: additionalText
slot.value: Unable to look up notification definition in database. The original notification data was: <event>

slot.name: description
slot.value: This event is generated when no definitions for a certain event can be found in the fm_event_def database.

slot.name: causeRaise
additionalText
slot.value: A backup has failed to start because the Heavy Disk Usage Lock was taken with the tag <LockTag>.

slot.name: description
slot.value: The backup has been blocked by the Heavy Disk Usage Lock. To prevent disk overload some operations that result in intensive disk usage on the FSB are protected by a lock. Only one such operation is allowed to run at any one time. A backup will not be allowed to start during startup or NCB failover, or when any of the following CLI commands are running: checkpoint, rm_sc, activate_sc, or action_sw_m_prepare_upgrade_package.

slot.name: causeRaise
slot.value: Backup is not allowed to start during startup or NCB failover, or when any of the CLI commands checkpoint, rm_sc, activate_sc, or action_sw_m_prepare_upgrade_package are running. This is to prevent disk overload.

slot.name: consequence
slot.value: The backup was not allowed to start due to heavy disk usage.

slot.name: action
slot.value: Run backup/periodic backup at later stage.

slot.name: additionalText
slot.value: The license < License Name> will change within 7 days.

slot.name: description
slot.value: The admLicenseChange event is generated seven days before a license expires.

slot.name: causeRaise
slot.value: A license feature or capacity will be changed in seven days according to the license key file.

slot.name: consequence
slot.value: If no action is taken, a license will expire in seven days.

slot.name: action
slot.value: A new license has to be purchased if the feature shall be used in the future.

slot.name: area
slot.value: SW Load Check and License Mgmt

slot.name: additionalText
slot.value: Diameter overload indication has been received from <Diameter entity>. Traffic reduction of <number>% has been requested for <number> seconds.

slot.name: description
slot.value: The event is generated when the MME is notified about overload of the Diameter entity through the S6a or the T6a interface. The Diameter entity is represented by a Diameter realm or a Diameter host.

slot.name: causeRaise
slot.value: The event is generated when Diameter overload indication has been received.

slot.name: consequence
slot.value: Reduced signaling load towards the overloaded Diameter entity according to received overload information.

slot.name: action
slot.value: No remedial action can be taken at the local node, only at the remote node.

slot.name: additionalText
slot.value: An updated GTP restart counter is received on the gtpc path = <SGSN VIP address and the external node VIP address, separated by an underscore> (Connection between this node and external node)

slot.name: description
slot.value: The gtpGSNrestarted event is generated after a GGSN restart and the GGSN notifies the SGSN-MME of the restart. #Note: When the gtpGSNrestarted event is generated, the gtpPathFailureControlPlane alarm may exist depending on the configured echo parameters over the Gn/Gp interface.Note#

slot.name: causeRaise
slot.value: This event is generated when the GGSN notifies the SGSN-MME about a GGSN restart through updating the restart counter.

slot.name: consequence
slot.value: The SGSN-MME may initiate a PDP context restoration procedure depending on the configuration of the Gateway Restoration Procedures feature.

slot.name: additionalText
slot.value: A large restart is in progress.(<Restart Trigger Type>)

slot.name: description
causeRaise
consequence
slot.value: All subscribers in the SGSN-MME are lost. Affected MSs and UEs are not notified.

slot.name: action
slot.value: If the event was caused by a software error, the relevant logs should be made available to Ericsson for analysis. For more information about what logs to collect, see #Troubleshooting#.

slot.name: additionalText
slot.value: <First occasion within configured period [time-period] hours when all SGWs are 'temporarily unavailable'. Affected area is [TAI or RAI] OR First occasion within configured period [time-period] hours when all SGWs are 'blocked'. Affected area is [TAI or RAI] OR First occasion within configured period [time-period] hours when all SGWs are under the combination of 'temporary unavailable' and 'blocked'. Affected area is [TAI or RAI]>

slot.name: description
slot.value: The event is generated when all SGWs that serve the area, identified by the TAI or RAI, are marked as "blocked" or "temporarily unavailable" at the SGW selection, and is the first event within the event notification period. The event notification period is specified by the GwEventNotificationPeriod parameter.

slot.name: causeRaise
slot.value: The event is generated when all SGWs that serve the area, identified by the TAI or RAI, are marked as "blocked" or "temporarily unavailable" at the SGW selection, and is the first event during the configured period.

slot.name: consequence
slot.value: Only the first sgwAllBlockedperArea event is generated at the SGW selection within the configured period.

slot.name: action
slot.value: For SGWs in the "temporarily unavailable" status, check the connectivity of the backbone network and make sure these SGWs are working properly. For SGWs in the "blocked" status, check if all of these SGWs can be set as "available".

slot.name: additionalText
slot.value: A DP take over has failed (EquipmentID=<EquipmentID>).

slot.name: causeRaise
slot.value: The event is generated when the DP takeover fails to recover subscribers.

slot.name: consequence
slot.value: A failure during DP takeover results in lost subscribers on the affected DP.

slot.name: action
slot.value: Relevant logs should be made available to Ericsson for analysis. For more information about what logs to collect, see #Troubleshooting#.

slot.name: additionalText
slot.value: Route Set available to destination <DPC> with route priority <number>. Affected NodeID is <number>, with Local SPC <number>.

slot.name: description
slot.value: The specified signaling route set is available to the specified destination.#Note: This event is only relevant in start-up.Note#

slot.name: causeRaise
slot.value: This indication is received when a signaling route becomes available for traffic to a previously unavailable destination.

slot.name: consequence
slot.value: The route set towards the specified destination is available.

slot.name: additionalText
slot.value: SCTP reestabl to <nodeType>, remote SCTP EP IPs <IPaddresses>, port <portno> initiated. Assoc lost: <SCTP Cause: [corresponding cause code]. Origin is [Local user|Remote user].>

slot.name: description
slot.value: This event is triggered for each of the first SCTP associations where reestablishment is initiated, up to 2 times per SCTP User (S1AP, SBcAP) and AP in a time interval of 60 seconds. The time interval is per SCTP User.

slot.name: causeRaise
slot.value: This event is triggered when reestablishment is initiated following an SCTP association loss.

slot.name: consequence
slot.value: There is no contact with the other node (eNodeB or CBC). The MME changes the state to ECM-IDLE for any UE handled by the eNodeB, and updates the bearer by sending a request to the SGW. SCTP associations reestablishment is initiated.

slot.name: additionalText
slot.value: ADD feature is not supported in HLR (reported in MAP Update GPRS Location Response message)

slot.name: description
slot.value: The mapAddNotSupportedInHlr event is generated when the ADD feature is not supported in one or several HLRs.

slot.name: causeRaise
slot.value: ADD feature is not supported by this HLR

slot.name: additionalText
slot.value: <Percentage> of subscribers fully lost due to the failure of multiple APs.

slot.name: description
slot.value: The event is generated when another AP failure occurs before the recovery of a previous AP failure is finished. All subscribers that are replicated to any of the remaining operational APs remain attached to the SGSN-MME and are recovered with session resilience. Lost subscribers that lose both the original and replicated subscriber data must reattach to the SGSN-MME. The percentage of the lost subscribers is indicated.

slot.name: causeRaise
slot.value: The event is generated when multiple AP failures occur within the same recovery window.

slot.name: consequence
slot.value: Subscribers that lose both the original and replicated subscriber data are lost and must reattach to the SGSN-MME.

slot.name: action
slot.value: Relevant logs must be made available to Ericsson for analysis. For more information about what logs to collect, see PIU or VM Failure in #Troubleshooting#.

slot.name: description
causeRaise
slot.value: The ss7AlarmEventStormInfo event is generated in the following situations: 1. When storm of a specific SS7 alarm or event, detected in the front-end or back-end process by exceeding the alarm-specific threshold is finished. 2. When storm of a specific SS7 alarm or event, detected in the SS7 O&M entity by exceeding the alarm-specific threshold is finished. 3. When storm of SS7 alarms and events, detected in the front-end or back-end process by exceeding the general threshold is finished. Alarms and events covered by alarm and event specific protection respectively are not taken into account.

slot.name: consequence
slot.value:
Depending on the original cause the following consequences are possible: 1. In case of alarm or event specific storm detection in the SS7 front-end or back-end process: The affected SS7 alarm or event from the affected process was not reported for around 30 seconds. Some of the affected SS7 alarms from the affected process were cleared even if the problem reported in the alarm is present.
2. In case of alarm or event specific storm detection in the SS7 O&M entity: The affected SS7 alarm or event from all processes was not reported for around 2 minutes. The affected SS7 alarm from all processes was cleared even if the problem reported in the alarm is present.
3. In case of general alarm storm detection in the SS7 front-end or back-end process a number of SS7 alarms and events from the affected process was not reported.

slot.name: related
slot.value: ss7AlarmStorm, ss7M3uaRemoteSpUnavlForUP, ss7M3uaAssociationDown, ss7EventStorm, ss7SccpRoutingFailure, ss7M3uaRemoteSpAvlForUP, ss7M3uaAssociationUp

slot.name: additionalText
slot.value: Heartbeat ack received for AssocId <number>, EqPos <EqPos>, InstId <number>. The RTT was <number> ms. IP addresses in the HB request: <number> (dest), <number> (orig), in the HB Ack: <number> (dest), <number> (orig).

slot.name: description
slot.value:
The sctpHeartbeatAck event is generated when a heartbeat acknowledge is received as a response to a management-initiated heartbeat request (initiated through the action_sctp_sys_hbreq CLI command).
This event returns the following information:*RTT;*Source and destination IP addresses from the heartbeat request;*Local source and destination IP addresses from where the heartbeat acknowledge was received;

slot.name: causeRaise
slot.value: Heartbeat acknowledge is received for a management-initiated heartbeat request.

slot.name: consequence
slot.value: Information about the Round-Trip Time, RTT, is received for an association between specified IP addresses.

slot.name: description
slot.value: The sctpAssocMovementFinished event informs that the individual movement of SCTP association triggered by the action_sctp_sys_assoc_move CLI command is finished. It contains information about the movement result and AssocId of the moved association. Depending on the movement result the following event texts can be displayed: Movement was successful: "Movement was successful. Association with AssocId <old AssocId> from SctpInst <SctpInstFrom> was moved with AssocId <new AssocId> to SctpInst <SctpInstTo> " Movement wasn't successful: "Movement wasn't successful. Result code <Result Code>. Association with AssocId <old AssocId> wasn't moved from SctpInst <SctpInstFom>"

slot.name: causeRaise
slot.value: The event is generated when the individual movement of SCTP Association is finished.

slot.name: consequence
slot.value: In case of successful result, association is moved from the source SCTP front end to the destination SCTP front end. SCTP traffic is not impacted. In case of unsuccessful result, the individual association movement cannot be performed for this association. If the movement is failed, the association can be lost.

slot.name: additionalText
slot.value: A small local restart is in progress on <EnodeId>.

slot.name: description
slot.value:
A small local restart restarts all SGSN-MME application processes in the control plane of one AP, see Architecture.
If the small local restart occurs on a local AP (AP/L), all subscribers are preserved, except those in a transitional state. Subscribers in a transitional state are removed from the SGSN-MME. The CDRs for the affected subscribers are closed with the cause abnormal release.
If the small local restart occurs on a central AP (AP/C), no subscribers are affected.
The variable ENodeID identifies a restarted Erlang node of the AP.

slot.name: causeRaise
slot.value: This event is generated when either an error in the control plane on one AP or an NCB failover occurs.

slot.name: consequence
action
slot.value: Relevant logs should be made available to Ericsson for analysis. For more information about what logs to collect, see #Troubleshooting#.

slot.name: additionalText
slot.value: MS move operation is stopped abnormally due to the licensed feature 'SGSN Pool for WCDMA' is not enabled in the target SGSN with NRI <NRI> and IP <IPAddress>.

slot.name: description
slot.value: This event is generated when a move operation, which is started by the action_pool_move_start, or action_pool_move_validation_start CLI command, is stopped. The move operation is stopped because licensed feature SGSN Pool for WCDMA is not enabled in one of the target SGSNs.

slot.name: causeRaise
slot.value: This event is generated when licensed feature SGSN Pool for WCDMA is not enabled in one of the target SGSNs.

slot.name: action
slot.value: The status of the move operation can be showed: *If the move operation is started by the action_pool_move_start CLI command, use the show_pool_move_job_status CLI command and the show_pool_move_target_status CLI command.;*If the move operation is started by the action_pool_move_validation_start CLI command, use the show_pool_move_validation_status or show_pool_move_validation_status_detail CLI command.;

slot.name: additionalText
slot.value: The license < License Name> is not available. The reason: <event>.

slot.name: description
slot.value: The admLicenseKeyNotAvailable event is generated when NeLS configuration exists and the License Manager on SGSN-MME node fails to retrieve license keys from NeLS server.

slot.name: causeRaise
slot.value: The reason for reporting of the admLicenseKeysNotAvailable event is that an error result is returned when the License Manager on SGSN-MME requests license keys.

slot.name: consequence
slot.value: The failed to be retrieved license keys will be not available to use on SGSN-MME node.

slot.name: action
area
slot.value: SW Load Check and License Mgmt

slot.name: additionalText
slot.value: No MBMS Session Stop Request has been received within time limit.

slot.name: description
slot.value: No MBMS Session Stop Request has been received. The maximum lifetime calculated from the session duration time in the MBMS Session Start Request has been excceded and the MBMS session will be closed.

slot.name: causeRaise
slot.value: The MBMS session duration time has expired and the MBMS session has been lost in upper nodes.

slot.name: consequence
slot.value: MBMS session stopped by the SGSN.

slot.name: additionalText
slot.value: A DP take over is in progress (EquipmentID=<EquipmentID>)

slot.name: description
slot.value: A DP takeover has been initiated.

slot.name: causeRaise
slot.value: The event is generated with DP loss or gain.

slot.name: consequence
slot.value: DP takeover with loss: All stable subscribers residing on the affected payload DP will be handled by remaining payload DPs in the SGSN-MME. DP takeover with gain: Load sharing will be performed to the added payload DP. A subset of stable subscribers on available payload DPs will be moved to the added payload DP.

slot.name: action
slot.value: Relevant logs should be made available to Ericsson for analysis. For more information about what logs to collect, see #Troubleshooting#.

slot.name: additionalText
slot.value: NS Status with cause code <cause code> received on IP path <local IP address>:<port> - <remote IP address>:<port> <conditional element>

slot.name: description
slot.value: An NS protocol error procedure has been initiated. The event text includes a conditional value that is dependent on the cause code.

slot.name: causeRaise
slot.value: This event is generated when the BSS sends an NS-STATUS PDU indicating a disturbance. The nature of the problem is described by the cause code submitted in the NS-STATUS message. The cause codes are derived from the 3GPP recommendation. The usage of cause codes in the BSS is implementation dependent and can vary between suppliers.

slot.name: consequence
slot.value: A problem in the BSS is indicated. At worst, this may impede the use of the remote IP endpoint for traffic. For more information on consequences, refer to the BSS documentation.

slot.name: action
slot.value: Contact the BSS O&M staff and provide them with the received cause code. Check for related alarms and events in the BSS and the SGSN.

slot.name: additionalText
slot.value: RNC = <rnc_name> is not included in the MBMS session.

slot.name: description
slot.value: This event is triggered when the SGSN has failed to include an RNC in the MBMS session.

slot.name: causeRaise
slot.value: This event is trigged by one of following reasons:;*An MBMS Session Start Response received without Transport Layer Information;*An MBMS Session Start Failure received;*The RNC has not responded within the time limit;*The GBR admission control has rejected to set up a payload tunnel;*SGSN receives an RANAP Error Indication message;

slot.name: consequence
slot.value: The RNC will not be included in the MBMS session.

slot.name: additionalText
slot.value: The Remote Process Outage state has ceased for signaling link on <number>.

slot.name: description
slot.value: The remote end of the link has recovered from the PO status and has resumed traffic. The link is a narrowband signaling link with EqPos, trunk and time slot.

slot.name: causeRaise
slot.value: The PO conditions at the remote end have ceased.

slot.name: consequence
slot.value: The remote end of the link will be available for network traffic. The link is a narrowband signaling link with EqPos, Trunk and Timeslot.

slot.name: action
slot.value: **There is no remedial action required. This alarm is of notification value only.;**If the module has the RPO flag set then the timer T1 is cancelled. If the ChangeBack flag is set the ChangeBack buffer is sent on the link. This traffic sequence is to be observed.;**If the RPO timer is running for this link is stopped and the traffic is resumed. Any messages buffered during RPO is sent initially to maintain traffic sequence.;

slot.name: additionalText
slot.value: Controlled rerouting performed towards DPC <number>. Affected NodeID is <number>, with Local SPC <number>.

slot.name: description
slot.value: Controlled rerouting performed to destination SPC with route priority prio from local SPC. The normal route to the destination is back in use. For ITU and TTC standards, both the SPC and DPC values are printed in the format: 0-16383 and 0-65535 respectively. For ANSI and China standards, both the SPC and DPC values are printed in the format: 0-16777215 ([0-255]-[0-255]-[0-255]).

slot.name: causeRaise
slot.value: Controlled rerouting is used when a signaling route to a given destination becomes available, that is, recovers from a previous remote failure in the signaling network. It is used to divert back the traffic to that destination from the alternative to the normal route (as specified in the configuration).

slot.name: consequence
slot.value: The traffic is diverted from the alternative to the normal route as specified in the configuration.

slot.name: action
slot.value: No remedial action is required. This event is of notification value only.

slot.name: additionalText
slot.value: A restart in the HLR with E.164 address <ADDRESS> has taken place.

slot.name: description
slot.value: The event is generated when a MAP reset message has been received from a HLR.

slot.name: causeRaise
slot.value: This event is generated when a restart in the HLR has taken place.

slot.name: consequence
slot.value: Increased SS7 signaling towards the HLR.

slot.name: description
causeRaise
slot.value: This event is generated after any type of startup when one FSB becomes primary.

slot.name: consequence
slot.value: Indicates that an FSB has become primary.

slot.name: additionalText
slot.value: A hanging PDP context in GGSN <address> is detected and the GGSN is informed.

slot.name: description
slot.value: The gtpHangingPdpContextInGgsnDeleted event is generated when the first hanging PDP context in GGSN is detected or every 500 handing PDP contexts in the GGSN have been detected since the previous occurrence of this event. #Note: Each time a hanging PDP context in the GGSN is detected, the SGSN sends a Delete PDP Context Request message to the GGSN.Note#

slot.name: causeRaise
slot.value: The gtpHangingPdpContextInGgsnDeleted event is generated when the first hanging PDP context in GGSN is detected or every 500 handing PDP contexts in GGSN have been detected since the previous occurrence of this event.

slot.name: consequence
slot.value: Reduced hanging PDP contexts in GGSN.

slot.name: additionalText
slot.value: Message received on a signaling link or association, containing a not allowed OPC <number> (screening active), adjacent DPC <number>. Filtered <number> times since last report.

slot.name: description
slot.value: This event is generated if a message, containing a not allowed OPC received on an MTP-L3 signaling link, is discarded by the OPC screening. OPC screening is used for security and network consistency reasons. For ITU and TTC standards, both the OPC and DPC values are printed in the format: 0-16383 and 0-65535 respectively. For ANSI and China standards, both the OPC and DPC values are printed in the format: 0-16777215 ([0-255]-[0-255]-[0-255]).

slot.name: causeRaise
slot.value: A received message contains a not allowed OPC.

slot.name: consequence
slot.value: The message containing the not allowed OPC is discarded.

slot.name: action
slot.value: **Check the SS7 log file for further details.;**Check the configuration for the given SPC in the network nodes.;**If problem is not solved, check the SS7 log file, ss7trace.log, for further details.;

slot.name: additionalText
slot.value: A restart in the HSS has taken place with HSS address <ADDRESS> <with Reset-ID RESET-ID>.

slot.name: description
slot.value: The event is generated when a HSS reset message has been received from a HSS.

slot.name: causeRaise
slot.value: This event is generated when a restart in the HSS has taken place.

slot.name: consequence
slot.value: Increased Diameter signaling towards the HSS.

slot.name: additionalText
slot.value: MME's configuration update of the connected eNodeBs incomplete.

slot.name: description
slot.value: This event is generated when one or more of the connected eNodeBs responded with a failure indication or did not answer, to an MME Configuration Update message.

slot.name: causeRaise
slot.value: One or more of the connected eNodeBs responded with a failure indication or did not answer, to an MME Configuration Update message.

slot.name: consequence
slot.value: Inconsistent MME configuration information in the radio access network.

slot.name: action
slot.value: Check the eNodeBs and the S1-MME connections to confirm or rule out any communication problems. Check the eNodeBs to determine if any relevant failure indication has been sent. Determine the cause of any failure indication if needed.

slot.name: additionalText
slot.value: BSSGP Error Procedure has been initiated on BVC number <BVC number>, NSE number <NSE number> with cause code <cause code>.

slot.name: description
slot.value: The bssgpStatusReceived event is generated when a BSSGP error procedure has been initiated. In worst case this can lead to that it is not possible to use the BVC to send GPRS traffic.

slot.name: causeRaise
slot.value: This event is generated when the BSS has sent a Status PDU message indicating some communication problem. The nature of the problem is described by the cause value.

slot.name: action
slot.value:
This event is generated when the BSS has sent a Status PDU message indicating some communication problem. The nature of the problem is described by the cause code according to the list below. All values not listed below shall be treated as "protocol error - unspecified" #Note: The cause codes listed here are in decimal notation, which is how they are printed by the alarm. However, in the 3GPP specification for BSSGP, the cause codes are expressed in hexadecimal. Note#
#Term: 00 Term##Def: Processor overload Def# #Term: 01 Term##Def: Equipment failure Def# #Term: 02 Term##Def: Transit network service failure Def# #Term: 03 Term##Def: Network service transmission capacity modified from zero kbps to greater than zero kbps Def# #Term: 04 Term##Def: Unknown MS Def# #Term: 05 Term##Def: BVCI unknown Def# #Term: 06 Term##Def: Cell traffic congestion Def# #Term: 07 Term##Def: SGSN congestion Def# #Term: 08 Term##Def: O&M intervention Def# #Term: 09 Term##Def: BVCI-blocked Def# #Term: 10 Term##Def: PFC create failure Def# #Term: 11 Term##Def: PFC preempted Def# #Term: 12 Term##Def: ABQP no more supported Def# #Term: 32 Term##Def: Semantically incorrect PDU Def# #Term: 33 Term##Def: Invalid mandatory information Def# #Term: 34 Term##Def: Missing mandatory IE Def# #Term: 35 Term##Def: Missing conditional IE Def# #Term: 36 Term##Def: Unexpected conditional IE Def# #Term: 37 Term##Def: Conditional IE error Def# #Term: 38 Term##Def: PDU not compatible with the protocol state Def# #Term: 39 Term##Def: Protocol error - slot.name: description
slot.value: A blocked equipment can be deblocked using the the deblock_eq CLI. That brings the equipment back into operation. A deblocked equipment is automatically rebooted before operation, for Linux based PIUs or VMs. Reconfiguration of the deblocked equipment might be necessary.

slot.name: causeRaise
slot.value: This event is generated when an equipment is deblocked from the CLI.

slot.name: additionalText
slot.value: Active RP is running on <Equipment ID>.

slot.name: description
slot.value: The routActiveRP event is generated to display the PIU that takes the role of the active RP.

slot.name: causeRaise
description
causeRaise
related

slot.name: additionalText
slot.value: Pool move operation is stopped abnormally due to the seamless pool move operation is not supported in the target MME with MMEC <MMEC> and IP <IPAddress>.

slot.name: description
slot.value: This event is generated if a pool move operation is stopped because one of the target MMEs does not support smooth move operations. The pool move operation, which is started by the action_pool_move_start or action_pool_move_validation_start CLI command, is only usable if both the source MME and the target MME support smooth move operations.

slot.name: causeRaise
slot.value: This event is generated when one of the target MMEs does not support smooth pool move operations.

slot.name: consequence
slot.value: The pool move operation is stopped.

slot.name: action
additionalText
slot.value: MS move operation is stopped abnormally due to the MS move operation without any trigger is not supported in the target SGSNs with NRI <NRI> and IP <IPAddress>.

slot.name: description
slot.value: This event is generated when a move operation, which is started by the action_pool_move_start, or action_pool_move_validation_start CLI command, is stopped. The move operation is stopped because one of the target SGSNs does not support the smooth move operation without a trigger, which is only applicable for WCDMA.

slot.name: causeRaise
slot.value: This event is generated when one of the target SGSNs does not support the MS move operation without a trigger.

slot.name: action
slot.value: Do not move the MS to the target SGSN using the MS move operation without a trigger.;The status of the move operation can be showed: *If the move operation is started by the action_pool_move_start CLI command, use the show_pool_move_job_status CLI command and the show_pool_move_target_status CLI command to check the status of the move operation.;*If the move operation is started by the action_pool_move_validation_start CLI command, use the show_pool_move_validation_status or show_pool_move_validation_status_detail CLI command to check the status of the move operation.;Restart the move operation without specifying the target SGSN.

slot.name: additionalText
slot.value: The < filename > log file was wrapped before the minimum time elapsed.

slot.name: description
slot.value: This event is generated for multiple-file logs when a log file is overwritten too soon by a new version. Each file in multiple-file logs has a sequence number which is appended to the filename. Wrapping is when one file has been filled, and the application starts writing log data to the log file with the next sequence number, overwriting a possible previous version of the file. When the file with the highest number has been filled, the application opens the file with sequence number 1 again.

slot.name: causeRaise
consequence
slot.value: For every log wrap, there is a risk of data loss. If these wraps occur too often, considerable amounts of logging information can be lost. Using the Maximum Wrap Loss setting, you can specify how great a portion of the maximum log size can be lost before an alarm is issued. An alarm is issued if two log wraps have occurred too close in time and the size of the file being overwritten is equal to or greater than the following value: Maximum Wrap Loss * Maximum File Size * Number of Files * 0.01

slot.name: action
additionalText
slot.value: S.M.A.R.T. attribute value(s) <= threshold at some time in the past.

slot.name: description
slot.value: S.M.A.R.T. status check returned "DISK OK" but found that some attribute values have been <= threshold at some time in the past.

slot.name: causeRaise
slot.value: Some S.M.A.R.T. attribute value(s) have been <= threshold at some time in the past.

slot.name: action
slot.value: Check S.M.A.R.T. log. See #Troubleshooting# for further information.

slot.name: additionalText
slot.value: Number of Out Of The Blue Packets crossed the high watermark threshold. Filtered <number> times since last report.

slot.name: description
slot.value: This event is generated when the number of Out Of the Blue (OOTB) packets exceed the high watermark threshold. Out Of the Blue packets are packets for which the receiver cannot identify the association to which the packets belong, even though they are correctly constructed. The value of the high watermark threshold is defined through the MaxNoOfOOTBPackets parameter for the time interval defined with the TimerResetOOTBPacketCounter parameter.

slot.name: causeRaise
slot.value: The threshold value defined in the SCTP configuration for out of the blue packets (OOTB) is passed. The threshold is defined for a time interval also defined in SCTP configuration. A packet is called OOTB if it has passed the receiver's checksum check but the receiver is not able identify the association to which the packet belongs. A normal init message could be seen as an OOTB message since there is no association established yet for this message, however only init messages for which no listener is established are counted. The reason why OOTB chunks are received could be that a malicious source is trying to generate load for the system to handle.

slot.name: consequence
slot.value: Extra load for the system to handle.

slot.name: action
slot.value: Find the source or sources which are sending the OOTB messages. The IP addresses are not logged in runtime for process capacity reasons. Find the reason why the source or sources are sending so many OOTB packets. Is there a malicious intrusion or just a malfunctioning node.

slot.name: additionalText
slot.value: The routing of the message failed as <entity> is unavailable. Affected NodeID is <NodeID>, with Local SPC <Local SPC>

slot.name: description
slot.value: The SCCP fail to route the message as the remote subsystem SSN or point code DPC is unavailable. Event storm notice: the event can be generated very frequently in some cases, for example, when a remote node is restarted, but the traffic is still sent from SGSN-MME. In order to prevent a heavy CPU load and unexpected restarts, the SS7 subsystem will automatically detect the storm and deactivate the event for about 2 minutes (after 2 minutes, event will be activated again). For ITU and TTC standards, both the SPC and DPC values are printed in the format: 0-16383 and 0-65535 respectively. For ANSI and China standards, both the SPC and DPC values are printed in the format: 0-16777215 ([0-255]-[0-255]-[0-255]).

slot.name: causeRaise
slot.value: The routing of the message failed as;1 the point code in the address is unavailable.;2 the subsystem is unavailable.

slot.name: consequence
slot.value:
If the subsystem is unavailable and no secondary routing has been deployed for this subsystem SCCP will advise other users of the status change and stop sending traffic to the SSN at the remote node.
If the point code in the address is currently unavailable the SCCP user can resend the message when the point code becomes available through the reception of an MTP_RESUME_ind.

slot.name: action
slot.value: Note that no remedial action can be taken at the local node, only at the remote node.

slot.name: description
slot.value: The fsbBackupComplete event indicates that the backup is completed successfully.

slot.name: causeRaise
slot.value: This event is generated when the backup is completed successfully.

slot.name: consequence
slot.value: The backup is complete and the backed-up data can be used during restore operations.

slot.name: additionalText
slot.value: A M3UA message was received, on association with RemoteSpId <number> and LocalSpId <number> on SctpEndPointNo <number>, from a peer node with an unsupported Network Appearance (<number>). Filtered <number> times since last report.

slot.name: description
slot.value: An M3UA message was received from a peer node with an incorrect Network Appearance (NA) for the configured local peer.

slot.name: causeRaise
slot.value: This event is generated when a message with an unsupported NA is received. The NA identifies an SS7 network context for the purposes of logically separating the signaling traffic between the SG and the Application Server Processes over a common SCTP association.

slot.name: consequence
slot.value: A message received with an unsupport NA is discarded.

slot.name: action
slot.value: Check the configuration, that is the NA value, for the given association. The NA of the network connected through this association and the NA of the association should be consistent. Check the SS7 log file, ss7trace.log, for further details. Take note of the NA.

slot.name: additionalText
slot.value: The SNS SIZE procedure for NSEI <NSE ID> in the dynamic configuration for Gb over IP has failed due to the following cause: <cause code>.

slot.name: description
slot.value: The gbipNseSizeProcedureFailed event is generated when the dynamic configuration procedure has failed due to problems in the SNS-SIZE procedure. The cause of the failure is provided in the cause field of the alarm text.

slot.name: causeRaise
slot.value: The cause values for this event are derived from those received in the SNS-SIZE message according to the 3GPP recommendations. They are used to indicate that the dynamic configuration procedure has failed for the following reason:;*The number of NS-VCs provided by the BSS are too low: The maximum number of NS-VCs sent from the BSS in the SNS-SIZE is lower than that required for full-mesh connectivity between the SGSN and the BSS.;*BSS sends IPv6 addresses: The BSS has indicated the usage of IPv6 addresses in the SNS-SIZE message. The current version of the SGSN does not support IPv6 addresses on the NS layer.;*BSS sends no IPv4 addresses: The BSS has not indicated any IPv4 addresses in the SNS-SIZE message.;*General protocol error: This cause value is used if the SNS-SIZE message is not formatted according to 3GPP recommendations or if no other cause value is applicable.;

slot.name: consequence
slot.value: The dynamic configuration procedure for this Gb interface has failed. The connectivity between the SGSN and the BSS cannot be established for this NSEI. The next SNS-SIZE message is not processed in the SGSN before the timer #GbIpNseNsSizeProcedureInterval# has expired.

slot.name: action
slot.value: Depending on the cause code, the following action is recommended:;*The number of NS-VCs provided by the BSS is too low: Involve the BSS O&M staff, increase the number of NS-VCs or decrease the number of IP endpoints in the BSS. The number of required NS-VCs for full-mesh connectivity must be equal to or greater than the product of the number of IP endpoints in the SGSN and the number of IP endpoints in the BSS.;*BSS sends IPv6 addresses: Involve the BSS O&M staff, review the configuration for Gb over IP in the BSS to make sure that the BSS is not using IPv6 addresses for the NS layer.;*BSS sends no IPv4 addresses: Involve the BSS O&M staff, review the configuration for Gb over IP in the BSS to make sure that enough IP addresses are locally assigned for the NS layer.;*General protocol error: Involve the BSS O&M staff, review the configuration for Gb over IP in the SGSN and the BSS for consistency. Review the IP routing between the SGSN and the BSS. Make sure BSS supports SNS signaling according to 3GPP.;Additional Information could be derived if the event #gbipNseNsStatusReceived# is generated for the same NSEI.

slot.name: additionalText
slot.value: A forced activation of configuration have been performed.

slot.name: description
slot.value: An operator have used the force activation command to activate a configuration. The configuration may be inconsistent and may cause problems.

slot.name: causeRaise
slot.value: An operator have used the force activation command to activate a configuration. The configuration may be inconsistent and may cause problems.

slot.name: consequence

slot.name: action

slot.name: additionalText
slot.value: The integration unlock period expires within seven days.

slot.name: description
slot.value: The admIntegrationUnlockExpire event is generated when the integration unlock period expires in seven days.

slot.name: causeRaise
slot.value: The integration unlock period expires in seven days.

slot.name: consequence
slot.value: The integration unlock period expires in seven days. The expiration disables all optional features and sets the capacity licenses to the lowest sellable value.

slot.name: action
slot.value: Install the License Key File (LKF) supplied by Ericsson or request a new LKF from Ericsson.

slot.name: additionalText
slot.value: An AP take over is in progress (EquipmentID=<EquipmentID>)

slot.name: description
slot.value: An AP take over has been initiated.

slot.name: causeRaise
slot.value: The event is generated at AP loss or gain. A severe software failure on an AP or an escalation has occurred.

slot.name: consequence
slot.value:
AP take over with loss: All stable subscribers residing on the affected AP will be handled by remaining APs in the SGSN-MME.
AP take over with gain: Load sharing will be performed to the added AP. A subset of stable subscribers on other available APs will be moved to the added AP.

slot.name: action
slot.value: Relevant logs should be made available to Ericsson for analysis. For more information about what logs to collect, see #Troubleshooting#.
